intro: Pseudolysimachion spurium subsp. foliosum, commonly known as the leafy spurwort, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the family Primulaceae. It is characterized by its basal rosette of lanceolate, serrated leaves and produces clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers in the summer. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It has a fibrous root system and is often found in temperate regions of Europe and Asia. The subspecies foliosum is distinguished by its more prominent foliage compared to other subspecies of Pseudolysimachion spurium.
